body:
You can do
```
if(!window) return
this.stripe = window.Stripe("pk_test_XiirziufElakjoOpyuyCrPfo")
``` 
If there is no window it will no continue to the next line. This is a pattern named fail early that I like.

You can also do
```
if(window) {
  this.stripe = window.Stripe("pk_test_XiirziufElakjoOpyuyCrPfo")
}
```
no need for a else when you do not want to do anything on else.

You should only have one item here, and its sku should be `this.props.sku` and its name `this.props.name`.

As the code stands now the user will buy all three.

body:
This is not technically wrong, but we usually define them right under the imports. With one line break in between:

```
import { Button } from "@material-ui/core"

const STRIPE_KEY = "pk_test_XiirziufElakjoOpyuyCrPfo"
// and the rest
```

body:
Material buttons do not except `buttonTextPropProp` as a prop. So remove as it is not good to have unused code.

Its also good to never name a prop, something with "prop".
